column1: Haru Yoshioka is a quiet and shy high school student who has a suppressed ability to talk with cats. One day
column2: she saves a cat from being hit by a truck on a busy road. The cat she saved turns out to be Lune
column3: Prince of the Cat Kingdom. As a thanks
column4: the cats give Haru gifts of catnip and mice
column5: and she is offered the Prince's hand in marriage. Her mixed reply is taken as a yes. Wanting none of this
column8: which tells her to seek Muta
column9: a large white cat and to seek directions for the cat bureau from him. Muta leads her there to meet Baron (the same Baron from Whisper of the Heart)
column10: who is a cat figurine given life by the work of his artist
column12: a stone raven who comes to life much like the Baron. Soon after meeting them
column13: Haru and Muta are forcefully taken to the Cat Kingdom
column14: leaving Toto and the Baron in the human world to follow the group from the air. The Baron and his crow friend find the entrance to the Cat Kingdom on Earth: Five lakes forming a cat's paw. Haru is treated to a feast at the castle of the Cat Kingdom and she begins to slowly turn into a cat with tan paws
column19: and for a second she gets fangs
column21: so that she will make a suitable bride for the Prince. At the feast
column22: Baron (in disguise) dances with Haru as part of the entertainment
column23: and reveals to her that the more she loses herself in the kingdom
column24: the more cat-like she will become
column25: and that she has to discover her true self. When Baron is discovered and is forced to fight the guards
column26: he and Haru are helped by Yuki
column27: a white female cat who works as a servant in the palace and who had tried to warn Haru to leave the Cat Kingdom before she was taken to the castle. After Yuki shows them an escape tunnel
column30: and Muta move through a maze to a tower
column31: which contains a portal to Haru's world. The King goes through a series of efforts to keep them in the Cat Kingdom long enough for Haru to remain trapped in the form of a cat and have her as his daughter-in-law. Lune and his guards return to the Cat Kingdom to reveal the King was not acting on his behalf and that he has no desire to marry Haru; he has instead planned on proposing to Yuki. Muta is revealed to be Renaldo Moon
column32: a notorious criminal in the Kingdom (having devoured a whole lake of fish in one session)
column33: and Yuki as being the strange voice who had advised Haru to go to the Cat Bureau. In her childhood
column34: Haru had saved Yuki from starvation by giving her the fish crackers she was eating
column35: and Yuki has now repaid her kindness. Muta
column36: or as he is known as the infamous criminal Renaldo Moon
column37: tells Haru """I" respect a woman who stands up for "herself""" after she rejects the King's marriage proposal outrightly and proceeds to help her escape from the King's soldiers. Eventually Baron
column38: Haru and Muta escape the realm of cats
column39: with the aid of Prince Lune and Toto
column40: and Haru discovers her true self and tells Baron how she has come to like him. He tells her the doors of the Cat Bureau will be open for her again. Haru returns to the human world with more confidence in herself; after learning from her friend
column42: that her former crush has broken up with his girlfriend
